metadata.name: Jess Mac - Dissociative Dreams - Frozen
metadata.description:
Dissociative Dreams is an ongoing series of AI artworks that explore dissociative states, both trauma-induced and through mediated relations. The project looks at responses of fight, flight and freeze through a series of imaginary worlds. 

Jess Mac is an interdisciplinary artist whose digital work has been shared through various online platforms, such as VICE Creator’s project, PAPER Mag, Art F City, Giphy and Tumblr. Their animations and videos have been screened internationally at festivals such as the Ottawa International Animation Festival, MIX-26 the New York Queer Experimental Film Festival, LA Film Fest at UCLA, Transcreen Amsterdam Transgender Film Festival, Inside Out Film and Video Festival (Toronto) and Mix Brazil Film Festival of Sexual Diversity (São Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, Brasilia, BR).  Jess has an MFA in Public Art and New Artistic Strategies from the Bauhaus University in Weimar, Germany.
